name: Alex B.
content: Once again my bike sat too long and needed a carb clean, new battery, and a few other minor things. I really didn't want to have to tow my bike in to a shop, so I decided to try Dripping Springs Powersports. Chris came out a few days later and got my bike up running in a couple of hours. Convenient, friendly service, and the price matched the estimate. Hard to beat that!

name: Zachary H.
content: This is by far the best motorcycle mechanic I've dealt with. He has worked on my bike twice both times the service and price were amazing. Chris said he would come over to my house and check it out but that it might be hard to find the hardware on a Saturday. By the time I got to work, 45 minutes later he had gone to my house diagnosed my bike and fixed it with extra parts he keeps on hand.

name: David M.
content: Chris does a great job and comes to you! Can't beat the convenience and service.

name: Troy W.
content: On Christmas, we discovered that a scooter that we had bought for our daughter back in October (worked perfectly then) would crank and idle, but it would die the moment that the throttle was applied. I called him to discuss the problem, and he said that it sounds like a simple issue. Chris came out and quickly pulled the carburetor. I couldn't be happier with Chris and wouldn't hesitate to call him again if the need arises.

name: Josh W.
content: Chris was awesome. He's always on schedule and is always very reasonably priced and helpful. He went way beyond the call of duty in assisting me with my temperamental chopper. If my bike ever needs work, he will be hearing from me.

name: Marvin J.
content: CALL THIS GUY! Can't beat his prices and the service. Came over and fixed my scooter. Diagnosed and fixed. Easy. Chris is the best! I highly recommend this guy.He answered all my phone calls and is very knowledgable. He fixed my scooter in no time! His price is great too. Call him!

name: Nathaniel D.
content: Can't say enough good things. He showed up at the house right on time, was happy to throw on the brake pads that I'd also purchased and generally provided great customer service. Afterwards, I threw him a couple questions about another bike we have in the garage with a bad engine, and I'm definitely comfortable with coming back to him to have that one worked on, also!

name: Pat H.
content: Chris just finished working on the carburetors on my 1983 Kawasaki GPZ 750. He did an outstanding job! He is very professional and went out of his way, (literally) to help me, as I live in Driftwood and he came from Austin. If I could give Chris 10 stars, I would.

name: Michael G.
content: Chris was easy to get a hold of and got me a scheduled within a reasonable time frame. I needed a carb clean and some electrical troubleshooting. He was in and out in an hour. Chris does fantastic work.

name: Andrew G.
content: Chris was great - personable, skilled and quick.  The final bill was very reasonable and the work well done.
